Can you run in debug mode and let us know what values are printed?

- copy plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime/.options to be a sibling of the eclipse 
executable
- change the following line to be true: 
org.eclipse.core.runtime/debug/context=true
- run the executable with -debug

Thanks.

So, I was too quick to say that everything was OK with the
LD_LIBRARY_PATH setup. Eclipse crashe at the very fisrt time
I touched the the directory tree in the resource perspective.
Teh generated log follows.

incze

Do you get the same stack trace?

Changing the directory name from x86 to i386 gives the same results.

Seemingly, in the file-tree widget is the culprit.
If it has on open directory when eclipse is starting the program is crashing.
When eclipse succeeded to start, all the highest level directoories were
closed. From the tp of the stacktrace I learned that when a directory was open,
the program tried to get the MIME type of the files in it (probably to apply
the appropriate icon).

        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.motif.KDE.KMimeType_allMimeTypes(Native
+Method)
        at org.eclipse.swt.program.Program.kde_getMimeInfo(Program.java:564)
        at org.eclipse.swt.program.Program.findProgram(Program.java:123)
        at org.eclipse.swt.program.Program.findProgram(Program.java:108)

And in the native method crashed.On more addition to the theme that the
tree widget is crashing ONLY if it was associated to a file tree, wher
nodes, other then directories can be found. I've managed to open the tree
widget in java perspective, and indirectories that contain only subdirectories.
So, the suspicious routine is really the native continuation of the

        org.eclipse.swt.internal.motif.KDE.KMimeType_allMimeTypes

java call.

incze

There were two problems here:

1) his VM was returning "i386" instead of the standard "x86" for the system 
property "os.arch".  This caused the initial UnsatisfiedLinkError exception.  
Core now handles i386 and maps it to x86, which should eliminate this first 
problem.

2) The second problem is the GPF in the KDE native code.  Moving to SWT 
component for further investigation.  I'm also updating the title to reflect 
this second error.
See full comment trail. User is seeing a crash in kde_getMimeInfo.

I have to assert that there were 2 errors (and one of them was cured by
renaming
the x86 arch directory to i386).

Just to add to the theme I've tested on another machine the latest
integration
build and it did not show this behaviour. This is a Redhat 6.2 with the
following relevant library numbers:

kernel-2.2.14-12
glibc-2.1.3-15
XFree86-3.3.6-20
kdebase-1.1.2-33
qt-2.1.0-4.beta1

The jdk is the sun 1.4rc1 the same way as in the crashy configuration.

Tested the new integration build (20020212) in the problematic
configuration, too. The x86->i386 problem seems to be resolved
(i.e. didn't have to rename the os/{arch} directory and the
eclipse could load the appropriate shared library). The crash
issue remained as before (but you guessed thatm, no miracles).

incze

Tested the new integration build (20020228) in the problematic
configuration, again. _The_crash_issue_disappeared_, altough
I couldn't find anything in the release notes that addressed
this bug directly. (So, there are miracles.) Either one of
the fixes relating to other issues cured also this one, or
after the changes this bug doesn't show itself in the usual
circumstances.

I've checked this bug's duplicates, and can assure, that
it is a workaround to remove the libswt-kde-motif-2029.so file.

Incze

I have been trying to reproduce this GPF without success. Does
it happen everytime you run eclipse?

I'm not sure what to answer. I can't say a loud "yes", because there
was a period when I've installed the 20020228 integration build and it
just worked. But only until I've rebooted my machine the day before
yesterday. Then all the builds after the 20020212 build crashed again
once I try to open a directory that contains files (not just directories)
in the navigator pane.

So, it behaves like some uninitialized varible bugs used to behave:
under some (very rare) circumstancies they work if accidentally the
values give a lucky combination, but crash reliably otherwise.

incze

Unfortunately, I *can* give a resounding yes.  It happens (and has happened) on 
every integration build and nightly build for quite a while now.  Since 0125, I 
believe.  This includes last night's 0307 integration build.

Just to make clear. I'm not sure that the "uninitialized variable"
is in the eclipse code - it can be a KDE bug, that shows itself
since the libswt-kde-motif-2029.so library is used. Any chance
to investigate what's the difference between the "old" (before 02.12)
KDE handling and the new one?

incze

The difference between the old (before 02/12) and the new one is that we
were not using libswt-kde-motif-xxxx.so because of another bug related with
XInitThreads(). We fixed that bug and started using the library. That is
why you only see the problem after 02/12.

I still cannot reproduce this problem, but I made changes to the library
that might fix it. I was wondering if you could try the changes for me, since
you can reproduce the problem consistently when running build 20020305.

I will attach the new library. You just need to replaced it:

	eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt/os/linux/x86/libswt-kde-motif-2029.so

Here is Marc's setup:

I am using red hat Linux 7.2 with all actual updates. 
Rest of my configuration:

eclipse-SDK-20020214-linux-motif.zip
j2sdk1.4.0
KDE 2.2.2-1

Staring up eclipse is no problem. But after opening
a new project and include a class eclipse crashes...
A KDE Bugreport Window pops up with the msg:
SWT Applikation crashes...

With gnome I have no probelms.....

Just so that other users who run into this problem know what the workaround is:
remove the kde-specific version of libswt from
./eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt/os/linux/x86

(the library name is called libswt-kde-motif-<ver>.so ... ie/
libswt-kde-motif-2031.so for motif build 20020325 )

As of yesterday's integration build (20020423), this bug seems to have
disappeared on my machine.  Since there has been a change in my configuration
(I've installed Enlightenment) I'll re-verify that previous builds aren't happy.

We have released code that will avoid the crash, but the
bug is not really fixed.

Reassigning to Christophe since he has been doing research in this area.

This is fixed in latest. The latest IBM VM (>= 1.4.1) will not crash anymore.
The program binding for KDE has been re-enabled for the Motif and GTK ports.
